page.title: 03Trees of the Forest
page.content: The bulk of the early plantings at Kielder were spruces. The{Sitka spruce}makes up 70% of all the conifers planted. It withstands the arctic conditions that are often experienced in the region. Nearer to the lake,on the lower land,{ {the Norway Spruce}is grown on the more fertile land. On higher land,where there is much heather,{Scots pines}and{Lodgepole {pines}are planted. In some areas the dark green of the pines and spruces contrasts dramatically with the light green of the{Japanese larch.} From the forest as a whole the annual harvest of timber is about 100,000 tons.
